docblock.long-description:
elasticsearch has for every types as a substructure. This object represents a type inside a context The hirarchie is as following: client -> index -> type -> document

Search over different indices and types is not supported yet {@link http://www.elasticsearch.com/docs/elasticsearch/rest_api/search/indices_types/}

elasticsearch has for every types as a substructure. This object represents a type inside a context The hirarchie is as following: client -> index -> type -> document

Search over different indices and types is not supported yet {@link http://www.elasticsearch.com/docs/elasticsearch/rest_api/search/indices_types/}

docblock.long-description:
Every entry in the params array has to exactly on array of the bulk operation. An example param array would be:

array( array('index' => array('_index' => 'test', '_type' => 'user', '_id' => '1')), array('user' => array('name' => 'hans')), array('delete' => array('_index' => 'test', '_type' => 'user', '_id' => '2')) );

docblock.long-description: All settings listed in the update settings API (http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-update-settings.html) can be changed on a running indice. All settings listed in the update settings API (http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/admin-indices-update-settings.html) can be changed on a running indice. Abstract helper class to implement search indices based on models.
docblock.long-description:
This abstract model should help creating search index and a subtype with some easy config entries that are overloaded.

The following variables have to be set: - $_indexName - $_typeName

The following variables can be set for additional configuration - $_mapping: Value type mapping for the given type - $_indexParams: Parameters for the index

tag.name: todo
tag.description: Add some settings examples to code

To use this feature you have to call the following command in the elasticsearch directory:

./bin/plugin -install elasticsearch/elasticsearch-mapper-attachments/1.2.0

This installs the tika file analysis plugin. More infos about supported formats can be found here: {@link http://tika.apache.org/0.7/formats.html}

docblock.description: Allow widcards (*, ?) as the first character in a query.
Enable best effort analysis of wildcard terms.
Set the analyzer name used to analyze the query string.

docblock.long-description:
A query that matches documents matching boolean combinations of other queries.

The bool query maps to Lucene BooleanQuery.

It is built using one or more boolean clauses, each clause with a typed occurrence.

The occurrence types are: must, should, must_not.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Sets the boost value of the query.

docblock.long-description:
A query that wraps a filter or another query and simply returns a constant score equal to the query boost for every document in the filter.

Maps to Lucene ConstantScoreQuery.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: The default field for query terms if no prefix field is specified.
The default operator used if no explicit operator is specified.
docblock.long-description: For example, with a default operator of OR, the query "capital of Hungary" is translated to "capital OR of OR Hungary", and with default operator of AND, the same query is translated to "capital AND of AND Hungary".

A query that generates the union of documents produced by its subqueries, and that scores each document with the maximum score for that document as produced by any subquery, plus a tie breaking increment for any additional matching subqueries.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Enable position increments in result queries.
Enables explanation for each hit on how its score was computed.

docblock.long-description:
Facets provide aggregated data based on a search query.

In the simple case, a facet can return facet counts for various facet values for a specific field.

ElasticSearch supports more advanced facet implementations, such as statistical or date histogram facets.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Add a specific field / value entry.

docblock.long-description:
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source. Passed parameters will be ignored, however they can be useful in source for seeing which field is being closed.

Elastica_Query_Builder::factory() ->query() ->range() ->fieldOpen('created') ->gte('2011-07-18 00:00:00') ->lt('2011-07-19 00:00:00') ->fieldClose('created') ->rangeClose() ->queryClose();

docblock.description: Open a node for the specified name.

docblock.long-description: Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.long-description: Used in range blocks.

docblock.description: Automatically lower-case terms of wildcard, prefix, fuzzy, and range queries.

docblock.long-description: Used in range blocks.

docblock.description: Add a less than or equal to (lte) clause.
docblock.long-description: Used in range blocks.

A query that matches all documents.

Maps to Lucene MatchAllDocsQuery.

docblock.description: The minimum number of should clauses to match.
The clause (query) must appear in matching documents.

docblock.long-description: Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: The clause (query) must not appear in the matching documents.
docblock.long-description: Note that it is not possible to search on documents that only consists of a must_not clauses.
Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: Sets the default slop for phrases.
docblock.long-description: If zero, then exact phrase matches are required.

Alias of close() for ease of reading in source.

docblock.description: The clause (query) should appear in the matching document.

docblock.description: Set the size parameter (number of records to return).

docblock.long-description:
Matches documents that have fields that contain a term (not analyzed).

The term query maps to Lucene TermQuery.

Abstract query object. Should be extended by all query types.
Runs the child query with an estimated hits size, and out of the hit docs, aggregates it into parent docs.
Runs the child query with an estimated hits size, and out of the hit docs, aggregates it into parent docs.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Query string or a Elastica_Query object

docblock.description: Set type of the parent document
Sets a param for the message array
Sets a param for the given field
Creates query string object. Calls setQuery with argument
Sets a new query string for the object
Sets the default operator AND or OR
docblock.long-description: If no operator is set, OR is chosen
If no field is set, _all is chosen

docblock.description: Sets the default operator AND or OR
docblock.long-description: If no operator is set, OR is chosen

docblock.description: Sets the analyzer to analyze the query with.
Sets the parameter to allow * and ? as first characters.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to true.

docblock.description: Sets the parameter to auto-lowercase terms of some queries.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to true.

docblock.description: Sets the paramater to enable the position increments in result queries.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to true.

docblock.description: Sets the fuzzy prefix length parameter.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to 0.

docblock.description: Sets the fuzzy minimal similarity parameter.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to 0.5
If zero, exact phrases are required. If not set, defaults to zero.

docblock.description: Sets the boost value of the query.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to 1.0.
If not set, defaults to false

docblock.description: Sets the param to automatically generate phrase queries.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to false.
If no fields are set, _all is chosen

docblock.description: Whether to use bool or dis_max quueries to internally combine results for multi field search.
When using dis_max, the disjunction max tie breaker.
docblock.long-description: If not set, defaults to 0.

docblock.description: Set a re-write condition. See https://github.com/elasticsearch/elasticsearch/issues/1186 for additional information
